instruction: How does the proposed MultiResoLCC method directly classify land cover using Very High Spatial Resolution (VHSR) imagery without the need for prior image sharpening or resampling processes?
Output: The proposed MultiResoLCC method directly classifies land cover using Very High Spatial Resolution (VHSR) imagery without the need for prior image sharpening or resampling processes by utilizing a two-branch end-to-end network. This network extracts features from each source (panchromatic and multispectral imagery) at their native resolution and then combines them to perform land cover classification at the PAN resolution. This approach eliminates the need for preprocessing steps such as pan-sharpening, allowing the machine learning algorithms to automatically transform the input data to best fit the classification task. The experiments conducted on real-world scenarios demonstrate the effectiveness and applicability of this method in operational settings.
